ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Patients have had alcohol consumption averaging at least 80 grams per day (for men) or 50 grams per day (for women), for at least 10 years.

Evidence of cirrhosis as per clinical signs and/or noninvasive transient elastography (Fibroscan) computed tomography, magnetic resonance imaging including MR elastography compatible with cirrhosis and/or histopathology by biopsy.
Subjects with clinical presentation either in Child Class A or B at the time of enrollment.
Active infection as evidenced by positive urine culture, blood culture, or pneumonia, if necessary, after review of safety labs showing abnormalities or determination by physical exam.
Serum creatinine greater than 1.5mg/dL
Known co-existing infection with hepatitis C, hepatitis B, or HIV.
Significant systemic or major illness including COPD, CHF and renal failure that in the opinion of the Investigator would preclude the from participating in and completing the study.
Participation in another investigational drug, biological, or medical device trail within 30 days prior to screening.
Gastrointestinal bleeding within the prior 28 days.
Women who are pregnant, may become pregnant, or nursing.
Presence of any other disease or condition that is interfering with absorption, distribution, metabolism, or excretion of SAMe such as patients who have undergone gastric bypass surgery.
Subjects with history of/diagnosis of hepatocellular carcinoma.
Members from the same family of study participant.
Subjects with psychiatric illness such as bipolar disorders.
Systemic antibiotic use or use of rifaximin for 10 days or more in the last 2 months before enrollment.
Was patient enrolled into the study?
Notes: 1= Yes; 2= No; If any of exclusion questions 1-12 are YES, STOP HERE! Patient is not eligible for enrollment.

ElementDescription: Date of enrollment:
